CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 12, 1952, pg. 34 reads: "New Electives Take Office - Two of the most controversial candidates but winners in the Nov. 6 elections attracted enormous crowds to the court house on Jan. 4 and 7. District Attorney James F. Malone Jr. took the oath of office Jan. 4 and State Senator John M. Walker was sworn in Jan. 7 as a minority member of the Board of County Commissioners.  Both are Republicans...At the bottom, left, is part of the huge crowd which greeted the new commissioners... Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Large group of women, including one left of center wearing dark jacket with checkered lapels, and dark hat with feathers, and men, gathered in Allegheny County Courthouse for swearing in ceremony of new Commissioners
